intro: Chaetanthera flabellifolia, commonly known as the flabellifoliate chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, featuring finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
